page.title: 02The Dee Estuary
page.content: { The Dee Estuary { *************** {The Wirral is flanked by two very {different rivers.The Mersey to the {east, which is now considerably {polluted, whereas the Dee, situated to {the west, empties much cleaner waters {into the Irish Sea. The Dee estuary {opens out to as much as five miles at {its mouth. It is made of sand, mud and {marsh-grass, particularly alongside {the Parkgate area. At low tide {the area consists of dangerous gullies {carved into the mud, and it is only at {very high tides that the water {approaches the sea wall at Neston cum {Parkgate. }
